Reviews.Title: BlackBerry Pearl 8130 review.
Reviews.Author: J. Holcombe
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a pretty nice phone but there are some minor things that could be improved upon. Instead of babbling on about things that don't matter, I'll just provide a list of pros and cons.PROS:-SureType keyboard makes a good alternative compared to the standard alphanumeric keyboards found in several flip phones.-Good speakers and 3.5mm headphone jack means that you can listen to music and videos however you want without the hassle of headphone adapters, protable speakers, and so on.-Nicely designed; not bulky or ugly like a lot of the phones out there.-MicroSD card slot means you can add more space to save pictures, videos, music, and so on.-Buttons on either side for one-push access to applications you can set for shortcuts to the appications.-Ambient light sensor means that you aren't wasting battery when you don't need the keyboard or screen backlights on, since it will automatically dim or brighten them for you in certain lighting conditions.-User interface is very adjustable with many options for user-customization.-Charging pod accessory makes for easy desktop docking.CONS:-Battery life isn't that great.-Internet upload/download speeds could be improved upon.-Camera photos, when viewed on a computer, aren't that clear.-Only 64MB memory standard means you almost definitely have to buy a MicroSD card to store your extra stuff.-No way to type accented letters in texts or emails.-Earpiece sound quality could be better.THE VERDICT: In this instance, the pros greatly outweigh the cons. If I were to rate this phone, I'd give it somewhere between 90-95%.

Reviews.Title: Not very happy
Reviews.Author: ajl
Reviews.Content: I received the original phone and the radio service wouldnt work on it so the phone could not be activated.  Sent it back, this time it worked but I cannot hear on this phone.  Took a month to get this all done and still no phone.  Finally got tiered of dealing with it and just renewed my Verizon contract.  Got a Blackberry Curve, love it, and now I can hear the person on the other line

Reviews.Title: Outdated
Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this phone because I shattered my iPhone. Grant it, I should have known a phone from the early 2000's was going to run much different than my iPhone. But I forgot how bad these things suck. Such bad speed and couldn't get any app's to work. I went back to the broken iPhone. It's a good back up phone. And I get it for a spare. But wow, it's just old school. Plus, paying for a data package and not getting your things at your finger tips, although you are paying for it, sucks. The seller is great by the way. So if you are buying this phone the seller is great to work with. I recived the wrong phone. Should of had a Verizon carrier but somehow got U.S Cellular. He sent an email asking how it was going, I explained that I would be returning it and he sent me the shipping materials and a phone that worked in my network. I did keep the phone because I could understand using as a backup. It wasn't too expensive either.

Reviews.Title: Great but with downfalls
Reviews.Author: Arran24
Reviews.Content: Great phone with so many options clearly marked by icons.  Love the bluetooth capability and really clear resolution of pics, even at 2.0 MP and one click access button on side. Its sleek and thin and shiney.  However, the QWERTY pad is too small for my big hands and makes texting slower and I ended up replacing with a BB Curve.  I even picked this up for only $15 used on Amazon.com.
